column5: hey guys after 11 hours of work decided to hit some creeks i know of, thinking i had all my fishing gear in the car , i soon realized i had forgot my spinning Rod at home, all what i had with me was my 4wt fly rod and my fishing tackle.goingthrough the pack i found one of my fly boxes. tried few nymph patterns and nothing, put on a purple wooly bugger  and this little fellow hit it.My First bass on a fly very impressive fight for it's size , snapped a quick picture (sorry about the quality)and let him go , got into 2 more bass but lost them  had to call it the day. sure looking forward to tying some more flies and hitting the water again. Tight lines Shadowfly
that is my goal this year or next, fly fishing for bass and walleye.  when I catch a walleye next time out I'm going to the fly gear (provided I'm in a boat).
Sweet!!!  Smallies on the fly would be a riot.
smallies on a fly are loads of fun. Got into a couple back on 24 long weekend up at Waterfalls Lodge.

Nice fish. I bet he gave you a run for your money on the 4wt. I've been chasing smallies around with my fly rod now for a couple years.Its addictive to say the least. Just got to make the transition from my float rod now and I'll be a full time fly guy on the river.
Nice.  What size of leader did you have to go up to? 3X?  Very nice fish indeed. Mike
Very nice....I fish river smallies with a 7-8 weight and even the little guys give a great account of themselves....would be a real battle on the 4w for sure!
hey mike didn't use a leader just 4 lbs maxima chameleon about 2 feet long cheers shadowfly
anytime Edwin I spotted some more bigger bass in the same area im gonna have a go at it again let me know when you want to join in and we'll go from there. cheers.
Great work. Kept saying I'm going to buy a fly rod and learn but never got to it.
